title: The Pink Floyd were recording in the same studio as The Beatles when the Beatles were recording Sgt. Peppers. Did the Beatles know of them at that time? - Quora
tags: Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band (1967 album)

response.answer_text: Pink Floyd was produced by Norman “Hurricane” Smith, who was George Martin’s engineer and right-hand man up to 1966. That year, he became a producer in his own right, and the first group he was assigned was Pink Floyd. During the Sgt Pepper sessions, Pink Floyd was recording in an adjacent studio, and Smith brought them over to meet the Beatles. It is not known what either band had to say to each other.

There were many projects being working on at Abbey Road in 1967. 1967: Don't Stop Me Now – Cliff Richard1967: Cinderella – Cliff Richard and The Shadows1967: Good News – Cliff Richard1967: Jigsaw – The Shadows1967: From Hank, Bruce, Brian and John – The Shadows1967: Evolution – The Hollies1967: Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band – The Beatles1967: Odessey and Oracle – The Zombies1967: Magical Mystery Tour – The Beatles1967: Butterfly – The Hollies1967: The Piper at the Gates of Dawn – Pink Floyd1967: Change of Direction – Brian Bennett1967: "Kites" – Simon Dupree and the Big Sound1968: Established 1958 – Cliff Richard and The Shadows1967: Two a Penny – Cliff RichardSeems like the place was busy. I have heard that the Beatles essentially ignored Pink Floyd who were in awe of them. I can see that. Paul and George were perfectionists who were without their manager and driven to make an album. Not sure I’d give an up and coming band my attention either.
